misconceptions.student_thought_process: The student correctly understands the required logic for a single right shift: save the last element, shift all other elements one position to the right starting from the end, and then place the saved element in the first position. The implementation `if(n>0){ int t=y[n-1]; for(int i=n-1;i>0;i--)y[i]=y[i-1]; y[0]=t; }` is fundamentally correct for this specific problem.
misconceptions.conceptual_gap: There is no notional machine misconception in the implementation logic itself. This code successfully performs the required operations (single right shift with wrap-around). The divergence is zero, as the output matches the expected shifted array based on the trace.
